abstract: Rumors may still be swirling over a takeover of Facebook, but the social network itself has struck a deal — for another company. In its first acquisition since its founding three years ago, the Internet’s second most popular social networking site has purchased Parakey, a start-up which had been trying to bridge the gap between information hosted on the Web and data stored on computer hard drives.
lead_paragraph: Rumors may still be swirling over a takeover of Facebook, but the social network itself has struck a deal — for another company. In its first acquisition since its founding three years ago, the Internet’s second most popular social networking site has purchased Parakey, a start-up which had been trying to bridge the gap between information hosted on the Web and data stored on computer hard drives.
